content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
In an attempt to achieve the above mentioned tasks, we propose an imitation learning based, data-driven solution to UAV autonomy for navigating through city streets by learning to fly by imitating an expert pilot.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

To assess the complexity of the passage, I'll break it down into its constituent parts. The most complex part of the text appears to be "imitation learning based, data-driven solution." This phrase contains a technical term ("imitation learning") that may be unfamiliar to non-experts, contributing to its complexity. The passage has a Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of around 9.3, indicating a high school or university-level complexity. This is above the desired complexity of a university student (DC), indicating that simplification is needed.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
imitation learning based, data-driven solution
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
machine learning based approach
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
In an attempt to achieve the above mentioned tasks, we propose a machine learning based approach to UAV autonomy for navigating through city streets by learning to fly by imitating an expert pilot.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentioned "imitation learning" which is a specific type of machine learning. The simplified passage generalizes this to "machine learning" which may result in some information loss (Severity: High). The original passage also specified that the solution is "data-driven" which is not present in the simplified version, resulting in additional information loss (Severity: High). The original passage specified that the solution is for "UAV autonomy" which is present in both versions, resulting in minimal information loss (Severity: Low). Overall, the information loss is significant, exceeding the ILT (Medium), so the changes should be rejected.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

High
No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

After rejecting the previous simplification, the most complex part of the text still appears to be "imitation learning based, data-driven solution." However, another part that stands out is "UAV autonomy" which may be unfamiliar to non-experts. The passage has a Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of around 9.3, indicating a high school or university-level complexity. This is above the desired complexity of a university student (DC), indicating that simplification is needed. The previous simplification attempt did not reduce the complexity enough.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"

Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
